newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil firms on futures, market moribund.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil firms on futures, market moribund.

text.p: NWE gas oil was slightly stronger on Friday as benchmark IPE futures recovered some of Thursday's losses but physical trade remained subdued, traders said.
June IPE was trading $1 higher at $166.75 a tonne at 1125 GMT, while the July contract was 75 cents up at $168.50 a tonne.
The heating oil barge market was deserted with premiums for first half delivery assessed at June IPE +50 cents/+$1.0 fob ARA.
Low sulphur diesel barges were also fragile. Fob Antwerp or Flushing barges were heard offered at June IPE +$8.25, while fob Rotterdam material was on offer at June IPE +$8.50 and +$9.0.
"It's very quiet. It looks like people have given up for the week," said one trader.
The cargo market was in a similarly moribund state.
Low sulphur cargoes were assessed at July IPE +$6.0/+$8.0 cif NWE.
Russian cargoes remained plentiful with diffs quoted at around June IPE +50 cents/+$1.50 a tonne.
